This place is very comfortable and clean! Just a few of the perks:
- My husband, who is straight out of the Goldilocks story and hates almost every bed on earth, was comfortable on the bed.
- There is a large grassy area for pets to do their thing. Please note that if you do not have good voice control they should stay on leash - while there is a fence, it is not completely fenced, and there is a good amount of wildlife (plus the chickens) on the property.
- The wildlife is also a perk - we saw quail, hawk, and some feral kittens... no, you don't get to keep the kittens.
- The AC worked great and kept the interior very comfortable in 110+ degree heat!
Some things to know:
- The water is from a well, and for the first few moments of running, it has a smell. This dissipates quickly and the water tasted fine. If you are sensitive to water in new areas, there is plenty of storage area on the counter for bottled water.
- If you bring dogs, be nice to Ryan and bring some poop bags :)
- Be sure to follow the detailed instructions for getting there, they were very helpful.
- There is a grocery store about five minutes away, so do not worry if you forgot anything.

Amber and Shaun were very pleasant to deal with and took my reservation on very short notice due to a family emergency. Communication with them was easy and they were very quick to respond. The house was in great proximity to where I needed to go and was in a great location for restaurants, stores, etc. The house is very quaint and was extremely clean. There were added little touches like a variety of Tazo teas, honey sticks, herbs, spices, etc. There is a large choice of dvds, reliable Wifi, an Alexa as well as many other things to make your stay pleasant. Having shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in the shower was very helpful and saved me on having to pack anything extra. The beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows.
This is obviously out of their control but the neighbors to the back of the house and to the side of the backyard have a dog that they allow to bark for extended periods of time, early morning and evening as well. I noticed quite a few little caterpillars in the kitchen and near the front door and relocated them outside the front door. When I opened the front door there were quite a few caterpillars out there and obviously where they were coming in from. The "sofa bed" that is listed is really not what I would consider to be a sofa bed and was extremely uncomfortable. I am only 5'4" but if a tall person were trying to sleep on it, they would have a difficult time. Besides the sofa in the living room there are two chairs that were just okay and positioned in a way that if there were more than one or two people it would be uncomfortable and difficult to watch the TV.
I would definitely stay there again should the need come up.

Well-furnished place in a fairly quiet subdivision. hosts were fast to respond. All of the amenities were there, except for the body wash, but they were apologetic when we mentioned it.
Unfortunately, the house needed some work in terms of hygiene. There was garbage left over in the kitchen and laundry room trash cans and the window jambs were covered in very thick dust, which was pretty gross to see. There was also a half open box of waffles left in the freezer.
Also, the host had a package delivered while we were there, which was kind of weird. We didn’t know what to do with it, so we just left it on the porch but we didn’t like feeling responsible for somebody else’s mail.
Overall it was fine, but it didn’t feel like the typical super host experience. I think with a deep clean and a little more attention to finishing the cleaning job before check-in would make a huge difference.
